decks.notes: The main idea of this deck is to quickly establish board presence and overwhelm the opponent with a combination of aggressive creatures and powerful ramp spells. By utilizing cards like Risen Reef and Leafkin Druid to accelerate mana production, the deck can quickly bring out powerful threats such as Uro, Titan of Nature's Wrath and Hydroid Krasis. The inclusion of cards like Agent of Treachery and Finale of Devastation provides additional versatility and late-game reach to ensure victory against a variety of opponent strategies.

This Sultai Aggro deck focuses on ramping quickly into big threats and overwhelming the opponent with powerful creatures. The key strategy revolves around using mana accelerants like Arboreal Grazer and Ilysian Caryatid to quickly get ahead on board, while also utilizing cards like Nissa, Who Shakes the World and The Great Henge to generate additional value and card advantage. With a mix of big creatures like Hydroid Krasis and Polukranos, Unchained, this deck aims to quickly establish a dominant board presence and put pressure on the opponent to close out games efficiently.

This deck aims to overwhelm the opponent quickly with aggressive creatures and cheap combat tricks to deal damage and control the board. By utilizing cards like Fervent Champion, Runaway Steam-Kin, and Grim Initiate, the deck can apply pressure early in the game. Light Up the Stage helps maintain card advantage while Embercleave provides a powerful finisher. The deck's reliance on creatures with haste and direct damage spells makes it capable of closing out games swiftly before the opponent has a chance to stabilize.

The deck focuses on generating mana advantage and card advantage through Wilderness Reclamation and Thassa's Intervention, while controlling the board with removal spells like Storm's Wrath and Brazen Borrower. Gadwick, the Wizened is used for card draw and tempo advantage. The deck also incorporates a small amount of land manipulation to ensure consistent mana base. Overall, the deck aims to maintain control over the game by efficiently answering threats and out-valuing opponents through card advantage and mana efficiency.

The main focus of this deck is to utilize various control cards to disrupt the opponent's strategy and maintain board control. By using cards like Teferi, Time Raveler and Thought Erasure to disrupt the opponent's hand, along with board wipes like Kaya's Wrath and Doom Foretold, the deck aims to control the game tempo. Elspeth Conquers Death and Ashiok, Nightmare Muse provide additional removal options, while Dance of the Manse can be used to bring back key cards from the graveyard. The mana base is built for consistency and to support the deck's multicolor requirements.

The deck aims to control the game through the use of Fires of Invention, allowing the player to cast spells for free. This strategy is supported by powerful planeswalkers such as Narset and Teferi, as well as board clearing spells like Time Wipe and Deafening Clarion. Fae of Wishes provides additional flexibility and access to a sideboard of powerful cards. The deck also includes finishers like Dream Trawler and Sarkhan the Masterless, while Kenrith, the Returned King offers additional utility. Overall, the deck focuses on establishing control early and maintaining it throughout the game.

The primary focus of this deck is to quickly and aggressively overwhelm the opponent with efficient creatures and powerful combat tricks. By utilizing cards like Rimrock Knight, Lovestruck Beast, and Bonecrusher Giant, the goal is to deal damage quickly and efficiently. The inclusion of cards like Embercleave and Domri's Ambush add additional firepower and removal options to ensure the deck can maintain pressure on the opponent. Klothys, God of Destiny provides additional value and disruption, while cards like The First Iroan Games help to refill the hand and keep the aggression going.

The main concept of this deck is to overwhelm the opponent with a stream of aggressive creatures and efficient removal spells. By combining powerful creatures like Bonecrusher Giant and Kroxa, Titan of Death's Hunger with cards like Embercleave and Shadowspear, the deck aims to apply constant pressure and disrupt the opponent's game plan. The inclusion of disruptive creatures like Hushbringer and Clackbridge Troll further adds to the deck's ability to control the board and push for victory quickly. The mana base is carefully constructed to support the deck's aggressive strategy.

This Bant Control deck focuses on ramping up mana with cards like Growth Spiral and Paradise Druid to quickly play powerful threats like Nissa, Who Shakes the World and Teferi, Time Raveler. It also includes disruptive elements like Elspeth Conquers Death and counterspells from Teferi to control the game. The deck aims to take control of the board and outvalue opponents with potential card advantage from Hydroid Krasis and Dream Trawler, while also utilizing Questing Beast for aggressive pressure. The mana base is designed to ensure consistency and access to all colors needed for the spells in the deck.

This deck focuses on controlling the game by using a combination of removal spells, counterspells, and powerful planeswalkers. It aims to disrupt the opponent's strategy while generating card advantage and gaining life. The deck includes board wipes like Planar Cleansing and Kaya's Wrath, as well as versatile threats like Dream Trawler and Ashiok, Nightmare Muse. It also features cards like Narset, Parter of Veils and Teferi, Time Raveler to shut down opposing strategies. With a mix of removal, card draw, and powerful threats, this deck looks to outvalue and outlast the opponent.

The primary theme of this deck is to overwhelm the opponent with aggressive, fast-paced creatures and combat tricks. By utilizing strong creatures like Questing Beast and Gruul Spellbreaker, along with powerful equipment like Embercleave, the deck aims to quickly reduce the opponent's life total. The inclusion of cards like Domri's Ambush and Bonecrusher Giant provide additional removal options to clear the way for attacks. The mana base is optimized with a mix of Mountains and Forests, along with a Castle Embereth for additional reach in the late game.

This Orzhov Aggro deck focuses on aggressively utilizing small creatures and enchantments to control the board and deal damage quickly. It combines efficient removal spells like Murderous Rider and Mire's Grasp with creatures like Healer's Hawk and Nightmare Shepherd for consistent aggression. The deck also benefits from enchantment synergy with cards like Starfield Mystic and Hateful Eidolon, while using cards like Heliod, Sun-Crowned and Aphemia, the Cacophony to generate additional value. Overall, the deck aims to overwhelm opponents early on and maintain pressure throughout the game.

The main theme of this deck is to control the game by using a combination of removal spells, discard effects, and enchantments like Doom Foretold to disrupt the opponent's strategy. The deck also includes powerful planeswalkers like Elspeth, Sun's Nemesis and Liliana, Dreadhorde General to generate value and close out the game. The use of Oath of Kaya and Cavalier of Dawn provides additional removal and synergy with the enchantments in the deck. Overall, the main concept is to outvalue the opponent and maintain control of the game until victory.

The main focus of this deck is to control the game by utilizing counterspells, removal spells, and card draw. The deck aims to slow down the opponent's game plan with cards like Storm's Wrath and Brazen Borrower, while also ramping and generating value through Wilderness Reclamation and Uro, Titan of Nature's Wrath. The deck seeks to maintain board control and card advantage, ultimately winning the game by outvaluing the opponent and overwhelming them with powerful spells like Expansion / Explosion. The mana base is constructed to support the deck's various color requirements efficiently.

The main focus of this UW Control deck is to use a variety of counterspells, board wipes, and card draw to control the game and out-value the opponent. With cards like Teferi, Time Raveler and Absorb to counter threats, along with Shatter the Sky to clear the board, the deck aims to stall out the game until it can land a powerful threat like Dream Trawler to close out the game. The deck also includes utility lands like Castle Vantress and Labyrinth of Skophos to provide additional control options.

The deck focuses on flooding the board with low-cost creatures and utilizing cards that provide additional benefits for having a wide board presence. By quickly building an army of small creatures, the player can overwhelm their opponent with a swarm of attackers while also maintaining some protection with cards like Unbreakable Formation and Tithe Taker. Elspeth, Sun's Nemesis provides a powerful finisher while cards like Heraldic Banner and Castle Ardenvale help to boost the power of the creatures on the board.
